{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3547283,"name":"Chadfrom7226","username":"Chadfrom7226","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/chadfrom7226/{size}/113429_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-04T16:52:00.157Z","cooked":"

Hey all,

My team is helping another team out with their swerve. They are new to swerve, so we got them set up with the AdvantageKit SparkMax template.

First off - thanks 6328! The AdvantageKit software is awesome.

The swerve setup is:
SDS MK4i L2
8x Neo
4x CANCoders
1x Pidgeon 2

What we have so far

  • Turn motors zero using the CANCoders successfully
  • Driving/strafing is mostly working as expected
  • Rotation somewhat works

The problems we are having:

  • 2 of the drive motors need to be inverted in the REV Hardware Client
  • rotation is backwards

What we’ve tried/checked:

  • CAN IDs are double checked and correct
  • Turn motors are zeroed and aligned
  • Gear ratios are correct
  • We didn’t have a flash drive so I wasn’t able to record logs. I can get those soon

The Code

github.com

GitHub - Team7818/2025-Robot

Contribute to Team7818/2025-Robot development by creating an account on GitHub.

Additional Info
What I want to avoid is putting bandaid fixes on things.

For example - I know I can put some additional constants and configuration for each drive motor to invert them, but I don’t know why only the (i think) left 2 drive motors need to be inverted when the turn motors work without issue

I also don’t want to just negate the rotation controller input because I don’t know how that might affect things like pathplanner or odometry.

Has anyone had similar issues? Can someone with a similar setup share their codebase?

Thanks in advance!

Regarding the inversions of the drive and turn motors, can you confirm that you followed steps 15-18 of the setup instructions? Here are the specific things I would watch out for in that process:

  • For step 15, make sure that the value of TurnPosition increases while turning each module counterclockwise. You may need to change turnInverted or turnEncoderInverted (all four modules should be consistent). Since you’re using CANcoders, I would also recommend checking the inversion of the encoders by logging their position separately in the IO implementation or using Phoenix Diagnostics.

  • For step 17, note the bolded text explaining how to calibrate the turn positions to match the drive inversion. The drive motors are not inverted by default, as this is accounted for by the zeroing process at this step.

Let us know if you have any additional questions.

Turns out there were two issues:

  1. I zeroed my wheels wrong. I put the gears towards the inside like CTRE makes you, but that’s not how it works for the spark template
  2. The controller’s X and Y axis were backwards and inverted (took 2 hours to figure that out)

Using the swerve visualizer in AdvantageKit helped me figure out the controller issue. I swapped it in code (and will probably swap to a new controller) and it worked

Thanks!
